CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company is a legal entity registered under NORP law with its office in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a company PERSON . ( “ PERSON . ” ) , pledged in favour of the applicant company real estate located in the town of GPE ( “ the real estate ” ) . The pledge was notarised and provided that in the event of default by PERSON . under the main agreement the applicant company could request a notary to issue a writ of execution regarding the real estate .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the applicant company 's request , the notary issued a writ of execution ordering that the real estate be sold by the ORG bailiffs at public auction and the applicant company 's claims be satisfied from the funds received .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG ( “ the Bailiffs ” ) instituted enforcement proceedings in respect of the writ of execution .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ordered that PERSON . pay CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) to the applicant company . The Bailiffs instituted separate enforcement proceedings in respect of that judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bailiffs joined the enforcement proceedings in respect of the writ of execution and the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Bailiffs , having failed to sell the real estate at public auction , transferred its ownership to a company , PERSON ( “ M. ” ) , which was one of the other creditors of PERSON . The applicant company challenged those acts of the Bailiffs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE declared the applicant company 's complaint against the Bailiffs inadmissible . The court noted that the complaint had been timebarred and , in view of LAW ( “ the ORG ” ) , could not be considered by the commercial courts , since it raised the issue of the allegedly inappropriate enforcement of a notary 's writ of execution , which was outside the competence of the commercial courts .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ ORG of Appeal ” ) , considering the applicant company 's appeal , decided that the complaint had been lodged in time but endorsed the conclusion of the first - instance court that the commercial courts had no jurisdiction over the complaint . The applicant company appealed in cassation against that resolution .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG imposed an interim measure , by which it attached the real estate pending consideration of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Higher Commercial Court quashed the resolution of CARDINAL DATE as unsubstantiated and remitted the case to ORG for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the commercial courts did have jurisdiction over the applicant company 's complaint , since the enforcement proceedings in question also concerned a judgment of a commercial court ( namely , the judgment of DATE ) . It further declared the decision of ORG unlawful and obliged them to sell the real estate at public auction at a reduced price .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the resolution of DATE , for the reason that the parties had not been duly informed of the hearing , and remitted the case to ORG for reconsideration .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , under the agreements of CARDINAL and DATE and CARDINAL DATE PERSON sold the real estate to ORG , a physical person .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the Bailiffs ' decision of CARDINAL DATE unlawful and obliged the Bailiffs to sell the real estate at public auction at a reduced price .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG of Appeal resolution of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the Bailiffs ' cassation appeal against the Higher Commercial Court resolution of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE V. lodged with ORG a cassation appeal against the Higher Commercial Court resolution of DATE . He asked for the time - limit for his cassation appeal to be extended for the reason that he had not been aware of the proceedings before DATE . He further requested that the proceedings be terminated as the commercial courts had no jurisdiction over the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave PERSON leave to appeal in cassation and instituted fresh cassation proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , considering ORG 's cassation appeal on the merits , found that the applicant company 's complaint referred to the allegedly improper enforcement of the notary 's writ of execution , while the commercial courts could deal with complaints concerning the enforcement of judgments , rulings , and resolutions taken exclusively by the commercial courts . It further held that at that moment the real estate was owned by a physical person . ORG therefore found that the case was outside the competence of the commercial courts , quashed the resolution of ORG of DATE , and terminated the proceedings in the case .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant company instituted proceedings in ORG against the Bailiffs and ORG , seeking to invalidate the Bailiffs ' decision of DATE and claiming damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found that the Bailiffs ' decision of CARDINAL DATE was unlawful . It further dismissed the applicant company 's claims for damages for failure to pay the required court fees . The applicant company did not appeal against that judgment . The Bailiffs appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the Bailiffs ' appeal as time - barred .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG of Appeal ruling of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the Higher Commercial Court resolution of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company instituted proceedings in ORG against the Bailiffs , ORG , and ORG , seeking damages in compensation for the unlawful decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the applicant company 's claim as time - barred and unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE . The applicant company failed to state whether it had appealed in cassation against the resolution of DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE ORG provides , inter alia , that legal entities and citizens who have been registered as private entrepreneurs are entitled to apply to commercial courts , in accordance with the relevant jurisdictional rules , for protection of their rights and interests .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ORG , third parties shall be admitted to proceedings before a judgment of the first - instance commercial court has been adopted and shall have the same procedural rights as the other parties .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ORG the parties to a case and a prosecutor have the right to appeal in cassation to ORG against a judgment of a first - instance commercial court which has come into effect , and against a resolution of a commercial court of appeal . A cassation appeal may also be lodged by persons who have not participated in the proceedings but whose rights and obligations have been affected by the impugned court decisions .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the ORG states , inter alia , that the parties to a case and ORG have the right to appeal in cassation to ORG against a Higher Commercial Court resolution .

CARDINAL . According to LAW resolution may be appealed in cassation to ORG within DATE of the date of its adoption . However , if the grounds for appealing in cassation arose after the expiration of this time - limit , the ORG shall be obliged to accept the cassation appeal for consideration .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the ORG provides , inter alia , that complaints about acts or omissions of the bodies of ORG concerning the enforcement of judgments , rulings , or resolutions of the commercial courts can be lodged by the creditor , the debtor , or the prosecutor within DATE of the date of the impugned measure or after the above persons have become aware of it , or after the relevant measure should have been taken .
